page.title: 05WATER SUPPLY HORNBY
page.content: Hornby Castle has its own water supply.The supply feeds the castle, the gas works and many of the houses in Hornby village.The water comes from a spring in the field opposite Park Chase.The spring has never dried up even in draught years.The water is very clear and very hard.It is piped across the field to the pump house. A small pipe from here used to feed a stand pipe in Hornby village.The two hydrams pump the water to the reservoir which is several fields away on higher ground.The reservoir holds 8,000 gallons of water and is 8 feet deep.The water falls by gravity to the Castle and other houses.Recently The nitrate content of the water has risen as a result of the nitrate fertilizers put on the farmland being absorbed by the rain water.
